meanings.definition: causing a change in form, nature, or substance
meanings.sent1: The transmutative potion turned the frog into a prince.
meanings.sent2: Her transmutative powers could alter the color of any object.
meanings.sent3: The transmutative spell accidentally changed the teacher's hair to bright pink.
meanings.sent4: The transmutative effect of time turned the once bustling town into a ghostly ruin.
meanings.sent5: The transmutative abilities of the caterpillar amazed the young children.

meanings.sent1: The transmutative nature of the artist's work captivated the audience.
meanings.sent2: The transmutative properties of the substance were well-known in the scientific community.
meanings.sent3: His transmutative skills in cooking turned a simple dish into a gourmet meal.
meanings.sent4: The transmutative power of music can uplift even the darkest moods.
meanings.sent5: The transmutative abilities of the superhero saved the city from destruction.

meanings.definition: relating to the process of changing or converting
meanings.sent1: The transmutative energy of the sun fuels all life on Earth.
meanings.sent2: The transmutative process of photosynthesis is essential for plant growth.
meanings.sent3: The transmutative experiment in the lab resulted in unexpected outcomes.
meanings.sent4: Her transmutative ideas revolutionized the way we approach problem-solving.
meanings.sent5: The transmutative force of love can heal even the deepest wounds.
